lenders.name: Gary
lenders.loan_because: it's the right thing to do!
lenders.occupational_info: Accountant for an International Oil & Gas Company

lenders.name: Jared
lenders.loan_because: Everyone needs a hand from time to time.
lenders.occupational_info: I look at tissue taken out of a person by a surgeon. I then tell the surgeon what the disease is (cancer or otherwise).

lenders.name: Robin
lenders.loan_because: I can.
lenders.occupational_info: I work with companies to determine and develop the best ways to train people on how to do their jobs well.

lenders.name: James
lenders.loan_because: I believe that small business loans to women are one of the best ways I can contribute to change in Africa.

lenders.name: Carolyn
lenders.loan_because: It helps those who wish to help themselves.
lenders.occupational_info: Empowering those to make a difference in their own life.

lenders.name: John
lenders.loan_because: An individual who has the means to make a difference to someone's life has a moral obligation to do so.

lenders.name: Gaby
lenders.loan_because: I want to help make a difference in the world.

lenders.name: Emily
lenders.loan_because: I have very few resources otherwise with which to help the people both around me and outside of my country - Kiva allows me to extend a helpful nudge where it's needed regardless of my circumstances, so I can always be sure that there is a way I can contribute.
lenders.occupational_info: As far as my job, you mean? I shave the hair off of wealthy people's dogs in fancy ways. Inglorious to be sure, but it's fun in a way and it gets me along. You meet the most interesting people in a grooming shop...

lenders.name: Diane
lenders.loan_because: I am blessed

lenders.name: Greg
lenders.loan_because: If you want to attain happiness, make others happy.

lenders.name: Susan
lenders.occupational_info: Educating students about the importance of Water.

lenders.name: Katy
lenders.occupational_info: community services worker

lenders.name: autumn
lenders.loan_because: we are called to reach out to the least of these...
lenders.occupational_info: just lovin' Jesus

lenders.name: Carina
lenders.loan_because: I like the entrepreneurial spirit in the people requesting loans.
lenders.occupational_info: I own four businesses with my husband and father - automotive center, childcare center, donut shop and information technology consulting. We also own some residential and commercial real estate.

lenders.name: Beth
lenders.loan_because: I can
lenders.occupational_info: journalist, dog lover, brown belt

lenders.name: Matthew
lenders.loan_because: Despite being as poor as I am, I want to find a way to help others.  I think this is a great way to assist people and it allows lenders to be in control of where their money goes unlike cryptically donating to a non-profit organization and not have any idea where your money actually ends up.  I have massive college loans and barely make enough to survive myself, but at 26, I can fully understand a lot of people have a much tougher life than my own and I am happy I can help people work towards improving their lives.
lenders.occupational_info: I am a first generation college graduate with a degree in linguistics and I play/write music in my free time.  Currently, I am completing my Master's at the University of Massachusetts, Boston in applied linguistics.  If you would like to check out my band, click on the link below:

lenders.name: George
lenders.loan_because: I have travel extensively in central and south america, have gotten to know the people, and I have seen the struggle that they have in trying to make a good life. In a small way, I hope to help those who are helping themselves.

lenders.name: Maia
lenders.loan_because: It's important to help others.
lenders.occupational_info: I am in 5th grade & I love music.

lenders.name: Jimmy and Judi
lenders.loan_because: We hope that our small part can help someone improve or change their lives.

lenders.name: Linda " Lulu "
lenders.loan_because: Because I want to......

lenders.name: Cheryl
lenders.loan_because: I am grateful to have a pretty comfortable life, and if I can use just a little of what I have to assist someone else with capital that can help them achieve their goals I am glad to do so.  I very much believe that a microloans program can change the world and eliminate poverty.
lenders.occupational_info: I am a teacher of English in a high school for students 14-18 years old.

lenders.name: Lenora
lenders.loan_because: It is the right thing to do. It is within all of us to  empower others to fulfill their dreams and live a life with hope.
lenders.occupational_info: I work for the government, to negotiate funding for agencies to deliver services to adults with developmental disabilities

lenders.name: Kriszta
lenders.occupational_info:
Call center manager: with big ears. I know everything about nothing.
Try to do the best: to overcome the material world.

lenders.name: Tricia
lenders.loan_because: It's the only way I know to help people who are not as fortunate as me

lenders.name: Sabina
lenders.loan_because: I believe helping someone realize their potential may be the best way to  not only help, but respect them.

lenders.name: Ulrike
lenders.loan_because: It's a great way to help!

lenders.name: Janice
lenders.loan_because: The world would be a much better place if we all just helped each other out.  Not everyone is as fortunate as many of us are.  It's a tough world out there for many people and if a simple donation can help improve their lives just a little, I think it's worth giving.

lenders.name: Erica
lenders.loan_because: I see the need to give others a fair go
lenders.occupational_info: Prepare children for the future. Give children the oppotunity to have a choice.

lenders.name: William
lenders.loan_because: Every once in a while i remember the many times i have lived on the mercy and kindness of strangers. They all wished me well, by word and deed. I hope to extend the same hand to others so that they too can fulfill their dreams. And the kindness of strangers spreads further into the world and for all times.

lenders.name: Juliarna
lenders.loan_because: I can and I care
lenders.occupational_info: I make jewellery that captures the very essence of your loved one as a special keepsake to treasure and cherish

lenders.name: Stefano
lenders.loan_because: I want to help the people
lenders.occupational_info: I'm writing software

lenders.occupational_info: I sell Printer for Industrie, ex. to print the Exp. Date on Food.

lenders.name: Linda
lenders.loan_because: a loan makes 'people' own their dream, instead of waiting for/ relying on charity!
lenders.occupational_info: I work as a clinical nurse specialist for childeren and families who are hiv positive.

lenders.name: Caroline
lenders.loan_because: I want to help people.

lenders.loan_because: I believe in teaching someone to fish, no matter where they are or where I am
lenders.occupational_info: I help people in my province, both homeowners and business owners, become more energy efficient and use less electricity. Lower electrical bills means less greenhouse gas and more money in your pocket to do something else, maybe lend on Kiva!

lenders.name: MCMARROW ENTERPRISES
lenders.loan_because: Sharing is the way for all mankind to survive the 21st century.
lenders.occupational_info: Promotes CD sales for concert artist Marie McMarrow  who has been performing for over 25years.We just learned about Kiva and wish to use part proceeds of the sale of sound tracks to  benefit other entrepreneurs around the world.

lenders.name: Iwan
lenders.loan_because: To make change happen.

lenders.loan_because: I teach an amazing group of caring young people who want to diminish poverty by helping people help themselves.
lenders.occupational_info: I teach high school economics.

lenders.name: Tyler
lenders.loan_because: I used to be in peace corps and my best friend in burkina could use something like this
lenders.occupational_info: I work for a large Northeastern Electric Company dealing with regulation issues.

lenders.name: Thorben
lenders.loan_because: I'm dedicated. Everybody should help to make this world a little better. I don't think that kiva.org is the best way to do so, but it's a sign. A sign towards people which have the hope to build up their own future. Use your hope since it gives you strength!
lenders.occupational_info: I help multiple disabled people living their own live like everyone else does.

lenders.name: Andrea
lenders.loan_because: I believe in supporting sustainable small business.
lenders.occupational_info: Helping creative people bring their vision to life.

lenders.name: Julia
lenders.occupational_info: I do internet stuff, mostly. I evaluate web sites and applications in order to make them easier to use.

lenders.name: Marion
lenders.loan_because: I would like to contribute in one small way to the world community..I am also interested in researching these loans in grad school.
lenders.occupational_info: I am a student- although almost done. Interested in sustainable development and micro-lending.

lenders.occupational_info: Diabetes research in biotech company

lenders.name: Megan
lenders.loan_because: it's a way to make a difference.
lenders.occupational_info: I am a sixth grade teacher in Atlanta, GA. I teach Language Arts (reading, writing, grammar, spelling) and History to eleven and twelve year olds. I do my best to teach them to be service-minded and socially responsible young adults.

lenders.name: Pam
lenders.loan_because: Helping someone out --- it's the right thing to do.

lenders.name: Carolyn
lenders.loan_because: For a few bucks - the price of two movie tickets  - I can join others to help someone increase their earning potential who otherwise could not. Lending also connects me with my neighbors across the world.
lenders.occupational_info: I help City of Seattle employees learn about their healthcare and employment benefits. I help City employees increase their well being through better eating, more exercise, and practicing relaxation.

lenders.name: Lorna

lenders.occupational_info: I own a clothing store called Bodacious that caters to the curvy ladies - selling beautiful clothing in sizes 10-24.

lenders.name: Alkis
lenders.loan_because: My friend Brooke introduced me to this back in 2006 and I believe it's a good cause. I think the tag line "loans that change lives" is great. This way you give a chance to less fortunate people to invest in themselves.

lenders.name: mark
lenders.loan_because: Helping people help themselves is the best help of all.
lenders.occupational_info: I develop training solutions for businesses.

lenders.name: michal
lenders.loan_because: i want to help @ i belive that we are all one
lenders.occupational_info: we are group of woman making entertainment for abride &  friends before wedding, (bachlorette party)

lenders.name: SUSAN
lenders.loan_because: I could either buy a book or help someone help their family, community and by extension, the world.

lenders.name: Almerico & Desa
lenders.loan_because:
while we personally believe debt is absolutely dumb for us, we also live in America where it is easy for us to earn money to invest in a business.  So debt here is not a necessity, but a choice.  We choose to be free.

However, we know that in countries less wealthy than ours, earning enough money to survive is sometimes impossible, let alone earning enough to invest in a business that allows you to thrive.  So, we feel these small amounts we loan, if they will help a family generate a living and thus be free of want in the future, are worth making.  And if they never get repaid, we are fortunate enough not to miss the amounts "lost" and will consider them a gift to our fellow human beings for the benefit of their happiness.
lenders.occupational_info:
Very happily married with no children.  

Desa, in her present occupation writes documents or edits documents that help other employees understand their job and perform it in a consistent manner.  However, she is also studying for a major in Herbal Science.  Her long term goal is to open her own organic, fair trade herbal products manufacturing company and farm.  She's already experimenting on us with her yummy concoctions!

Almerico presently manages an outsourced sales team for AT&T in a company that he opened with his best friend.  After this business is sold off, he plans to work for the company Games Workshop or to open his own gaming hobby store.  Meanwhile, he's content to spend every free moment absorbed in his tabletop strategy game hobby, Warhammer 40k.

lenders.name: Kya
lenders.loan_because: I look forward to taking part in Kiva because I believe in the idea behind it. What a great way to empower someone, and to keep empowering those who follow after them as well.
lenders.occupational_info: I want to study early childhood development so I can teach and work with children.

lenders.name: Birgit
lenders.loan_because: I believe together we can change the world day by day.

I feel this is a direct way to help

help themselves.

lenders.loan_because: I can!

lenders.loan_because: I am "paying forward". I had helped a neighbor and she sent me a gift certificate to Kiva as a thank you. I had never heard of Kiva before - what a great concept!
lenders.occupational_info: I am an assistant professor at a private, liberal arts university. I teach future teachers and early childhood education. I enjoy every minute of it!

lenders.name: Kiva Engineering Team

lenders.occupational_info: We build and maintain the Kiva.org website.

lenders.name: CJHS & FSHS
lenders.loan_because: We want help make the world a better place by doing our share and a little bit more!

lenders.name: Brad
lenders.loan_because: It's a good thing to do.
lenders.occupational_info: I write software.

lenders.name: Joel
lenders.loan_because: I strongly feel that topdown government sponsored 'free' Aid is not the way forward, because it often doesn't benefit the targeted people. Bottom up approaches like Kiva are a much better approach for giving real people in need a real chance to improve their livelihood.
lenders.occupational_info: I work in public health research

lenders.name: Lisa
lenders.loan_because: I grew up on a farm, and I know how incredibly difficult it can be to survive in that life. I also know how success can make a person feel, and how it can only multiply to an even more successful future. I have received a lot of support through all of my life, and I want to do the same for others that dedicate their life to hard work.

lenders.loan_because: I like to know where my money is going. I am pleased because it's doing good. :))
lenders.occupational_info: I run the household while elderly parents run about.

lenders.loan_because: We beleive the world will be a better place if everyone is given a chance to help themselves provide for their family

lenders.name: Andrew & Amber
lenders.loan_because: It's a way of having a positive impact while preserving the wealth for future use.  Meanwhile, we continue to give in other ways.

lenders.name: Courtney
lenders.loan_because: I can.

lenders.name: Ann
lenders.loan_because: i have the good fortune to be able to...and it's good karma:-)

lenders.occupational_info: I work online helping other people get their business done more productively.

lenders.loan_because: Some say that money makes the world go round but I like to think that there's a deeper meaning to it all than just that. Its nice to know that something commonly associated with greed and corruption and be turned into social utility, connecting people and empowering them in the most economically simplistic way.
lenders.occupational_info: Aspiring urban geographer

lenders.name: Andreas

lenders.name: Joseph Law
lenders.loan_because: There is a wise Chinese saying "Give a man a fish and you feed him for a day. Teach a man to fish and you feed him for a lifetime". I support this kind of giving as it empowers the recipient to live a life with dignity and confidence, rather than reliance.
lenders.occupational_info: Joseph Law is the founder and CEO of Living Greatness, a social organization dedicated to making the world a happier and better place by empowering people's lives through education and charity. Joseph is the author of Living Greatness: A Practical Guide to Living an Enlightened Life. His work has attracted and won the support of international best-selling authors, leading CEOs, as well as billionaires and celebrities worldwide. He is an ambassador for Make-A-Wish Australia.

lenders.name: Gill
lenders.loan_because: I want to help others help themselves

lenders.name: Michaela
lenders.loan_because: it helps others

lenders.loan_because: it makes a difference!

lenders.occupational_info: I design houses, interiors, kitchens, baths and gardens and it is very rewarding work and lots of fun for me.

lenders.name: Christiane
lenders.occupational_info: i´m teaching drama in education: theater is everywhere!

lenders.name: steve
lenders.loan_because: I have been so blessed just by being born in the USA and I believe, as the bible teaches, that we are here to reflect God's love to others  by sharing and giving to those who have less.

lenders.name: Nina

i can. 
it's a way to help, without costs for me and with visible success.

lenders.name: Vicky

lenders.name: Suzanne

Kiva offers me the opportunity to continue helping people, and in doing so,  to assist many more people the opportunity to realize 
their dreams and to create a better life for themselves and their families.
No matter who we are, or where we live, we all want something better for our children and this is a wonderful program to aid people in achieving  that reality.
lenders.occupational_info: Rewarding!  Knowing that I have the ability to assist my clients in the purchase of their home, whether it is their first home or their dream home, or re-financing to make funds available for that "dream purchase" or funds for college tuition or helping their children get off to a good start.

lenders.name: Sascha
lenders.loan_because:
After 5 years of membership, 36 loans made with a total 
$950 I'm going to end my support for Kiva since they fail  to make a satisfactory statement about their connection with Opus Dei. For more information click my website link.

I'll let my loans end and then will withdraw my money from Kiva... 

Looking for other projects to support - suggestions welcome

lenders.name: david
lenders.loan_because: i believe that since God has given me the resources to help people i will give it back to Him by loaning to people in need

lenders.name: Lynda
lenders.occupation: Letter Carrier for Post Office and Writer

lenders.name: Lori
lenders.loan_because:
As a small business owner myself, I know how important capitalization is. 

I  also think that anyone with a good idea who is willing to work hard should have the opportunity to put their dreams into action- no matter where they live.

The main reason, however, that I loan is because it makes me happy.  People helped me when I got started and now I can help others.
lenders.occupational_info: I help families plan and save for their financial futures.

lenders.name: Nicole
lenders.loan_because: I feel very blessed in my life and want to do my share to help others. I would like to support especially women with young children, as I am in a family/work situation as well.

lenders.name: Seema
lenders.loan_because: I can

lenders.name: Stefano
lenders.occupational_info: Italian information technology consultant, specialized in network security, now in the logistics field. I’m a relentless, outspoken and passionate geek since ever.

lenders.name: Andrea Knagenhjelm
lenders.loan_because: I want to help people have a better life. I like this idea because you are actually loaning money directly to the person in question without middlemen. A little for us is alot for others. We are so privileged , why not share this with others!
lenders.occupational_info: I work with administrating network computers and applications on them.

lenders.name: Khalid
lenders.loan_because: I believe in giving everyone a chance to prove themselves, and because it's a better, sustainable way of giving.  I owe my love of business and entrepreneurship to the first loan my parents gave me as a kid.
lenders.occupational_info: I run marketing & business development efforts for a firm that specializes in commercial interiors.

lenders.name: Eva
lenders.loan_because: I am fortunate with so many things and it feels good to give something back!

lenders.name: Dana
lenders.loan_because: In my past banking life I had to turn down many applicants for bank loans.  Need and entrepreneurial skills were never the criteria that was used.  I heard many stories that broke my heart.  Loans were made based on risk models alone and I had no power to overturn declines.   I like being able to loan a small amount of money and have it positively impact someone's life.

lenders.name: Stephen
lenders.loan_because: I want to help people who are trying to make a better life for themselves.
lenders.occupational_info: I am the only computer person for a small insurance company. I do all of the programming and fix the hardware when needed.

lenders.name: Julie
lenders.loan_because: I believe in hard working people.  They always seeking for chances to improve their lives with hard works.
lenders.occupational_info: Just a little helping hand.

lenders.name: valerie
lenders.loan_because: I want to share some of my good fortune with others, to let them know that others care and want to help.
lenders.occupational_info: I helped to take care of sick people, and helped communities develop ways to provide health services to the general population.

lenders.name: Melissa
lenders.loan_because: the only difference between the entrepenuers on this site and myself is the countries we were born in. Neither of us got to choose, and neither of us were more deserving of our places of birth. Since I was lucky enough to be born in Canada, it's my responsibility to help those who got less lucky than myself. No matter where we're born, we all deserve a fair shot at life.

lenders.name: Miryam Lavalle
lenders.loan_because: We can make a better world,for us and our children, if we help each other.
lenders.occupational_info: I help other people and their children to get better chances in Germany through a good Integration.

lenders.loan_because: I can

lenders.loan_because: it changes lives which in turn changes communities.

lenders.name: Stephen
lenders.loan_because:
"The cynic knows the price of everything and the value of nothing."
It's time for me to give back after a lifetime of taking. I believe in "Karma" and I'm sure what I do in this life will echo forever in the next. I hold fundamentally to the theory that what I do to others will be done to me and that everyone is equal. So giving is receiving is giving...
lenders.occupational_info: I am a consultant in the hardrock mining industry. I have over 23 years experience in; mining infrastructure both surface and underground, civil construction works, bulk earth-works and special projects.

lenders.name: Gia-Ninh

lenders.occupational_info: I work in the hospitality business (hotels and food and beverage), so I have an affinity for restauranteurs anywhere.  It's a tough way to make a living under the best of circumstances!

This foundation - Kiva - is truly a blessing. I am grateful that even with a little bit of my money, I can help someone and their family tenfold across the world.

lenders.occupational_info: I am a police detective.  I investigate crimes against children.

lenders.loan_because: I believe in people. And I believe in the possibilities of social changes through economic progress.

lenders.occupational_info: Tom Cotter is a solar expert, climate educator, carbon activist, social entrepreneur, blogger and clergy. Tom is Sales Manager of Residential and Small Commercial at REC Solar for the Central Valley region of California.

lenders.name: Chris
lenders.loan_because: I live in the United States of America, one of the easiest countries in the world to get on your feet or change your situation.  That being said I also know what it's like to have absolutly nothing and not able to get any financial help.  We all need help to get started!

lenders.name: Jennifer and Chris
lenders.loan_because: we believe in the power of micro-financing to change the world one entrepreneur at a time.
lenders.occupational_info: We both help organisations to improve their businesses.

lenders.name: Marc
lenders.loan_because: I was in Phnom Penh for a couple of days in 2007, and took a motorcycle ride to Choeung Ek. On the way back to my hotel, the driver told me about how he owned this motorcycle, but sometimes he could borrow his brother-in-law's car to make even more money, transporting bigger groups in comfort. He was curious about life in America, and when he heard that I used to have a car, he got excited and asked if I could loan him money to buy a car, too. Before I could answer, he quickly sketched out a repayment plan, describing month-by-month how much money he would repay me. Of course, I barely had any money (I'd sold the car a while back), let alone the amount he needed, so I had to turn him down. But it left me with the feeling that he could do great things if he had the chance. So, through Kiva, I hope I can finance a few people like him.
lenders.occupational_info: I'm a freelance writer in Chicago.

lenders.name: Reilly
lenders.occupational_info: I help people deal with emotional issues they're facing.

lenders.name: Leslie
lenders.loan_because: I wish for people to get ahead...have some choices, and  to be given a chance to try...
lenders.occupational_info: I travel between hospitals in our region to share education sessions with nurses on new equipment/supplies and procedures  needed for women and child care focus.  I move information from research into practice... to benefit the care of our patients.  I write learning packages within my expertise, to prepare new staff for their roles .

I met many Kiva-funded borrowers to learn how the loans they took impacted their lives, and worked with partner microfinance institutions to build capacity and help them be as successful as possible on Kiva.

lenders.name: Gnosis Lodge
lenders.loan_because: Freemasonry is an ancient system designed to impart morality, ethics and teach mutual service to its members. Instead of lecture or sermon, Freemasonry instructs its members by the performance of ceremonial degrees, each one with its own distinct teachings, symbols and message. Thus the Freemason is taught by experience to serve God, help his fellow man and better himself.
lenders.occupational_info: American Co-Masonry is an organization whose purpose is to provide a guide to its members for their spiritual growth through a series of progressive steps.  Co-Masonry counts among its members men and women of all races, creeds, colors, and nationalities who are 21 years of age or older, have a belief in a Supreme Being, and a desire for more understanding about the spiritual nature of mankind.
